bug.short_desc: Fatal error: Quoted string w/o end quote in parse_cached_envelope

long_desc.thetext:
I get hundreds of these in my /var/log/imapd.log : Fatal error: Quoted string w/o end quote in parse_cached_envelope
I can't find any information regarding this problem. Could this error be a cause of high CPU usage by imapd daemons ?
Are you using the latest 2.2 code (2.2.12)? I seem to recall a bugfix related to parse_cached_envelope() and SORT/THREAD
Can you get a protocol dump so I know what command is failing?

"Request: 00000001 LOGIN username password" "Response: 00000001 OK User logged in" "Request: 00000002 CAPABILITY" "Response: * CAPABILITY IMAP4 IMAP4rev1 ACL QUOTA LITERAL+ MAILBOX-REFERRALS NAMESPACE UIDPLUS ID NO_ATOMIC_RENAME UNSELECT CHILDREN MULTIAPPEND BINARY SORT THREAD=ORDEREDSUBJECT THREAD=REFERENCES ANNOTATEMORE IDLE LOGINDISABLED LISTEXT LIST-SUBSCRIBED X-NETSCAPE" "Request: 00000003 SELECT INBOX" "Response: * FLAGS (\Answered \Flagged \Draft \Deleted \Seen)" "Request: 00000004 LSUB "" INBOX.*" "Response: * LSUB () "." "INBOX.Sent"" "Request: 00000005 LIST "" INBOX" "Response: * LIST (\HasChildren) "." "INBOX"" "Request: 00000006 NOOP" "Response: 00000006 OK Completed" "Request: 00000007 UID SORT (REVERSE DATE) US-ASCII ALL" "Response: * SORT* BYE Fatal error: Quoted string w/o end quote in parse_cached_envelope"
Try reconstructing the mailbox and see if it makes a difference. Otherwise, I'll probably need to see the offending message (if you can figure out which one it is).
Apparently fixed by Greg, open a new bug if you still get it in 2.5
